alert.note: Alert for Washington (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 PM EDT, Local emergency dispatch reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms resulted in some minor flooding on Preston Street and Church Street. Minor flooding should continue to subside over the next hour as no more rainfall is expected. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abingdon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
